intro: Eurybia pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of only a few inches, making it a low-growing perennial. Its flowers are yellow with a dark center, and it blooms from late summer into early autumn. Eurybia pygmaea prefers moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sun, often found in woodland edges and open fields.
